com.team08storyapp

Class Choice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team08storyapp.Choice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Choice
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Choice is a model for the possible choices a Story Fragment may contain. A Choice for a Story Fragment leads the Story to another Story Fragment of the Reader's choice.

    A Choice has the following properties:

    • Choice Id to uniquely identify the choice.
    • Text displayed for the choice.
    • Story Fragment Id of the Story Fragment to go to from the choice.
    These properties are able to be accessed through the constructor or through public getters/setters.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0 November 8, 2013
    Author:
    Michele Paulichuk, Alice Wu, Ana Marcu, Jarrett Toll, Jiawei Shen
    See Also:
    StoryFragment, Story, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Choice

        public Choice(int toGoToStoryFragmentID,
      int choiceId,
      java.lang.String text)
        A constructor for creating a Choice object. This is the only constructor used and is used to help setup the Choices to display for a Story Fragment for when a Story is being read by a user or saving Choices when an Author is writing a Story. The following properties must be known at time of creating a Choice object:
        • Story Fragment Id
        • Choice Id
        • Text
        Parameters:
        toGoToStoryFragmentID - Story Fragment the Choice leads to.
        choiceId - Unique identifier of the Choice.
        text - The text to display to the Choice.
